basics.name: J.D. Peiffer
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: J.D. is a PhD Candidate working at the intersection of computer vision and biomechanical modelling.

publications.name: Differentiable Biomechanics for Markerless Motion Capture in Upper Limb Stroke Rehabilitation: A Comparison with Optical Motion Capture
publications.summary: Validates our computer vision approach to gold standard biomechanics in the upper limb.

publications.name: Fusing Uncalibrated IMUs and Handheld Smartphone Video to Reconstruct Knee Kinematics
publications.publisher: 2024 10th IEEE RAS/EMBS International Conference for Biomedical Robotics and Biomechatronics (BioRob)
publications.summary: Presents a deep learning approach to fit a biomechanical model to video and IMU data collected during walking.

publications.name: Biomechanical Arm and Hand Tracking with Multiview Markerless Motion Capture
publications.publisher: 2024 10th IEEE RAS/EMBS International Conference for Biomedical Robotics and Biomechatronics (BioRob)
publications.summary: Applies earlier joint optimization of biomechanical models to the ARMS Lab's leading hand model.

publications.name: Hyperpolarized 129Xe MRI, 99mTc scintigraphy, and SPECT in lung ventilation imaging: a quantitative comparison
publications.summary: Compares a recently FDA approved method for lung imaging to the clinical standard in a large patient cohort.

publications.name: Optimizing Trajectories and Inverse Kinematics for Biomechanical Analysis of Markerless Motion Capture Data
publications.summary: Develops a novel approach to jointly optimize body scale and joint paramaters for markerless motion capture.

publications.name: Self-Supervised Learning of Gait-Based Biomarkers
publications.summary: Creates a transformer that given timeseries of gait data learns a self-supervised embedding space useful for downstream tasks.

publications.name: Enhanced selectivity of transcutaneous spinal cord stimulation by multielectrode configuration
publications.summary: Explores electrode placement and configuration to improve the selectivity of transcutaneous spinal cord stimulation.

publications.name: Markerless Motion Capture and Biomechanical Analysis Pipeline
publications.summary: Hardware and software pipeline for markerless motion capture and biomechanical analysis.

projects.name: Deep reinforcement learning for global trajectory tracking
projects.summary: Incorperating phyiscal constrains such as forces and torques enable us to create physically grounded reinforcement learning policys to more accurately model movement in global space and measure joint torques.

projects.name: Single camera human pose estimation
projects.summary: Accurately recoving human pose from a single camera could democratize access to biomechanical analysis and enable big data studies of human movement. My algorithms incorperate physical constraints to improve accuracy and interpretability.

projects.name: Video-IMU fusion for human pose estimation
projects.summary: While video is a powerful and accessible sensor, it will always be limitied by occlusions. This work combines video and IMU data to improve accuracy and robustness of human pose estimation.

volunteer.summary: Developed interactive sessions for high school students to learn about biomechanics, prosthetics and computer vision.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
